Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Characteristics of Ozone Pollution and High-impact Meteorological Factors in Urban Cities: A Case of Suzhou].

AbstractText: The problem of urban ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) pollution has become prominent in recent years. However, the meteorological factors associated with O<sub>3</sub> pollution remain unclear. Analyzing the characteristics of O<sub>3</sub> pollution in Suzhou, as a typical urban city, and exploring the high-impact meteorological factors with O<sub>3</sub> pollution are crucial to the prevention and control of air pollution in this region. This study used correlation analysis and machine learning methods to analyze the variation in O<sub>3</sub> concentration and the relationship between meteorological driving factors in Suzhou based on the O<sub>3</sub> concentration data provided by Suzhou Environmental Monitoring Center and the contemporaneous meteorological observation data in Suzhou from April to September in 2015 to 2020. The results showed that: ① O<sub>3</sub> pollution exceeding the standard rate was more than 20% in ozone seasons during the past six years; further, pollution days of O<sub>3</sub> and the number of pollution days of O<sub>3</sub> as the primary pollutant increased yearly. Evidently, the problem of O<sub>3</sub> pollution has become increasingly prominent. ② The diurnal variations in O<sub>3</sub> were unimodal with the valley point at 07:00 and the highest peak between 15:00 and 16:00. Similar trends were found in diurnal variations of both air temperature and solar radiation, but the daily highest peak came earlier than that of O<sub>3</sub>. The results also showed an apparent weekend effect of O<sub>3</sub> concentration in 2017 and 2019 and a significant correlation between O<sub>3</sub> concentration and solar irradiance during the week. In addition, the monthly variation in O<sub>3</sub> concentration and pollution exceeding the standard rate was bimodal. ③The occurrence of ozone pollution was affected by various meteorological conditions. The maximum number of days appeared when daily sunshine hours lasted longer than 7 hours, with a daily maximum air temperature around 30℃, solar irradiance ranging from 350 to 440 kW·m<sup>-2</sup>, and relative humidity ranging from 50% to 75%, at which time the intensity of pollution was the strongest. When the wind speed of easterly wind was less than 1.5 m·s<sup>-1</sup>, or the wind speed of southwest wind was less than 3.5 m·s<sup>-1</sup>, moderate ozone pollution occurred. ④ An optimal prediction model of O<sub>3</sub> concentration was established based on machine learning, which had good predictive ability for O<sub>3</sub> concentration in April, May, July, and September but did not perform well when O<sub>3</sub> concentration exceeded 200 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>. Meanwhile, it was found that solar radiation had the most obvious effect on O<sub>3</sub> concentration, followed by relative humidity, whereas the temperature and wind were less important than the former two factors.
